Package view

Class WordleGUIView

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
view.WordleGUIView
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class WordleGUIView extends javafx.application.Application implements Observer
This uses JavaFX to create a GUI for the game Wordle which is supposed to be more or less a clone of the original game play and visuals. However, it allows you to play infinitely unlike the original.
Author:
Leighanna Pipatanangkura
See Also:
  • WordleController
  • WordleModel

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      This is the main entry point for all JavaFX applications. This method is called after the main (init) function is called, and when the system is ready to begin running.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Throws:
      IOException

    • addTiles

      private javafx.scene.layout.GridPane addTiles(WordleGUIView.Tile[][] tilesArray)
      Creates the game tiles that the player will see. These also update when the user enters a word. These tiles change color: Yellow: Correct Letter, but Wrong Index; Red: Incorrect Letter; Green: Correct Letter; These tiles also are animated too
      Parameters:
      tilesArray - are the collection of tiles to be laid out. They are in this array so it is easier to update and animate once the user has interacted with it.
      Returns:
      the GridPane that displays all the tiles is returned to be displayed.

    • letters

      private javafx.scene.layout.GridPane letters(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane[] keyboardTiles)
      Creates the letters to be displayed in the keyboard below the word tiles. Like the word tiles, these change color corresponding to the correctness of the letter entered.
      Parameters:
      keyboardTiles - are the collection of the letter tiles (to form the keyboard). They are in this array so it is easier to update and animate once the user has Interacted with the interface.
      Returns:
      The GridPane that displays all the tiles is returned to be displayed.

    • keyPress

      private void keyPress(WordleGUIView.Tile[][] tiles, javafx.stage.Stage stage, WordleController controller)
      This handles the events for the game. This includes the all the key presses: 1) ENTER: When the user presses enter, the word is submitted and evaluated. Error messages will be displayed if the word is not long enough or if the word does not appear in the dictionary. It also checks is the game is over or not so the correct answer can be displayed. 2) BACKSPACE: when the user presses back space. deletes the previous word. 3) Any alphabetical key press: the ultimately put together to form the user's guesses. The tiles are also animated as they are typed in.
      Parameters:
      tiles - These are updated as the user enters letters in
      stage - This is passed in so we can update the tiles on the screen
      controller - This is passed in so we can tell if the user won or not and if the game is over.

    • letterPress

      private void letterPress(String letter, WordleGUIView.Tile currentTile)
      This handles the animation and updates the letters being typed by the user. As each key is pressed, the tile is wiggled and the tile is darkend.
      Parameters:
      letter - This is the letter being typed in which will be updated onto the tile.
      currentTile - This is the current tile we are on that will be updated with a letter and animated.

    • enterPress

      private void enterPress(WordleGUIView.Tile[][] tiles, WordleController controller)
      This handles when the ENTER key is pressed. It ultimately sends the guess to the controller to be evaluated. An alert will pop up if the user guesses: 1) a word that is not in the dictionary, and 2) a word that is too short (less than 4 letters)
      Parameters:
      tiles - The tiles are passed in so we know what the user's guess is.
      controller - the controller is passed in so we can send the guess to be evaluated.

    • getWord

      private String getWord(WordleGUIView.Tile[][] tiles)
      The method retrieves the current guess and returns it so we can send it to the controller to be evaluated.
      Parameters:
      tiles - These are the tiles we are currently dealing with.
      Returns:
      Returns the user's guess in a string format.

    • backSpacePress

      private void backSpacePress(WordleGUIView.Tile curTile)
      This handles when a backspace is pressed. The previous tile gets blanked out and formatting is wiped.
      Parameters:
      curTile - This is the tile to be wiped.

    • update

      public void update(Observable model, Object arg1)
      This updates the view. So the tiles animated, and the keyboard is updated to reflect the correctness of each letter guessed.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer

    • updateTiles

      private void updateTiles(WordleModel game)
      This updates the tiles after the letters in the guess has been validated. The tiles are flipped to reveal the color that reflects their correctness.
      Parameters:
      game - This is the WordleModel which is passed in to check the correctness of the guess.

    • updateKeyboard

      private void updateKeyboard(WordleModel game)
      Updates the keyboard under the tiles to reflect the correctness of what the player has already guessed.
      Parameters:
      game - This is the WordleModel which is passed in to check the correctness of the guess.

    • flipTile

      private void flipTile(WordleGUIView.Tile tile, int col)
      Implements the animation to flip the tile over when the player has made a guess.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile to be animated.
      col - This is used to calculate the delay of animation between each tile.

    • wiggleRow

      private void wiggleRow(WordleGUIView.Tile tile)
      Implements the animation to wiggle the tile.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile to be wiggled.
